I came to web development from a career in market research consulting, which included the UX research that initially sparked my interest in code. From my previous work, I bring with me extensive experience in project management and team collaboration, an eye for usability, and a sensitivity to broader business objectives.

To accelerate my learning in programming, I recently attended the Recurse Center, a three-month self-directed retreat in New York City which brings programmers together for knowledge sharing, pair programming, technical talks, and social events.

Projects

TimeTiles Web App

Try it

Email: test@email.com
Password: tiles

Front End

API

JavaScript, React, Redux, Node, MongoDB

When I began learning to code, I realized that the "use it or lose it" nature of learning meant a linear, to-do list approach wouldn't be effective.

I created TimeTiles as a way to log your activities and time spent toward different goals, and then view at a glance what you've been up to. Tiles lighten or darken in color according to how recently you've worked toward a goal and the total time you've spent.

This project was an opportunity to develop skills in:

  • Managing app state with Redux
  • Creating a RESTful API with Node and Express
  • Client-side routing with React Router v4
  • Server-side authenticaion with JSON Web Tokens (JWT), Passport, and bcrypt
  • Writing maintainable CSS with SCSS partials and component-based stylesheets

Design Portfolio Website

Visit the site

View the code

JavaScript, HTML, CSS

Lauren is a design strategist who was seeking a simple, modern, and responsive site to showcase her work for those interested in contacting her for teaching and conference speaking engagements.

I enjoyed working with Lauren to build a site that met her needs and matched her design aesthetic.

Stay tuned! I'll be adding more projects soon.
